description: This function generates a visual representation of a rectangle with one side length displayed, the other labeled as '?', and the area of the rectangle displayed inside. It is designed to help students visualize and understand the concept of area in geometry, and how it relates to the dimensions of a shape.

educational_standards.description: Given the area and a side, find the missing side length.

stimulus_type_specification.title: Available Images: Rectangles with Side Length and Area
stimulus_type_specification.description: This function can generate images of rectangles with one side length displayed, the other side length hidden, and the area of the rectangle displayed inside. It accepts inputs of length, width, and units for the rectangle. The function scales the rectangle to fit well in the figure, with a target maximum dimension of 8 units. The educational purpose of this function is to help students understand the concept of area in geometry, and how it is calculated from the dimensions of a shape. It can be used in lessons on geometry, area calculation, and understanding dimensions.

details: length: The length of the rectangle
width: The width of the rectangle
unit: The units for the dimensions of the rectangle
The length and width must be positive numbers
The unit must be a valid unit of measurement
The maximum dimension of the rectangle is 8 units
The function draws a rectangle with one side length displayed, the other side length hidden, and the area of the rectangle displayed inside
The rectangle is drawn to scale, with a target maximum dimension of 8 units
The dimensions and area are displayed in the appropriate units
